messages: f7e3a9ff9d5e25805185757f8b416e28 (17:33): i'm wondering why build.sh build fails on this box. i had problems earlier with /tmp mounted nosuid,noexec,nodev
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (17:33): ascizo: I build all the time on a machine with var nosuid
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (17:34): what branch are you trying to build?
f7e3a9ff9d5e25805185757f8b416e28 (17:34): i need to try building again with better logging
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (17:34): I tried a release of that yesterday, broken :)
f7e3a9ff9d5e25805185757f8b416e28 (17:35): oh. really? my src is from yesterday :)
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (17:35): are you trying to build a release?
ed5dd9d10388fc6e54cc32959e4c54ad (17:35): if you set DESTDIR to /, then it will install stuff to /var
ed5dd9d10388fc6e54cc32959e4c54ad (17:35): but nothing else i beleieve
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (17:36): ascizo: well I haven't tried that, but it could have been in that part, I only noted the failure
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (17:37): Nodsu: or, you could use build.sh install=/
ed5dd9d10388fc6e54cc32959e4c54ad (17:37): that's pretty much the same, is it not? :P
f7e3a9ff9d5e25805185757f8b416e28 (17:37): imo it's a bad idea to do install=/
f7e3a9ff9d5e25805185757f8b416e28 (17:37): building sets first is a good idea
ed5dd9d10388fc6e54cc32959e4c54ad (17:37): but one never knows what people may come up with
f7e3a9ff9d5e25805185757f8b416e28 (17:45): oh. there's a cvs tag for 3.0.1 already :)
3107edcfd63ae66710572fa06df470dd (17:47): did anyone ever had that kind of problem ?

f7e3a9ff9d5e25805185757f8b416e28 (17:59): Nodsu: btw. from mk.conf man page "DESTDIR: This pathname should not end with a slash (/) character (for installation into the system's root directory, set DESTDIR to an empty string)."
ed5dd9d10388fc6e54cc32959e4c54ad (18:00): well, i have never done such a silly thing before :P
f7e3a9ff9d5e25805185757f8b416e28 (18:01): hehe. i didn't knew that either. i was reading mk.conf for fun :P
ed5dd9d10388fc6e54cc32959e4c54ad (18:02): ah well, time to go home
3107edcfd63ae66710572fa06df470dd (18:24): 15:21:24 <@TGEN> _aki: it's possible the interface between the bootloader changed between 3.0 and -current
5a88748c4bb3824bcfff53e433213900 (18:26): bootloader/openfirmware is something I don't want to touch before the boot-drives crashes
3107edcfd63ae66710572fa06df470dd (18:31): i don't really have the choice
